inclusion.criterion: male and female patients of all races
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: patient is a 34-year-old African American man

inclusion.criterion: adult and pediatric patients with Hb SC disease
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: able to swallow the Mg pidolate preparation
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: at least one prior painful crisis
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: patient had severe pain in his lower back that radiated to both thighs scored 9 out of 10

exclusion.criterion: transfused within 90 days of study entry
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: elevated (>1.5 times upper limit of normal for age) BUN, creatinine, or liver function tests > 3 times the upper limit of normal for age
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: lab study: Hgb: 8 g/dl, AST: 22 U/L, ALT: 43 U/L, Alk P: 53 U/L

exclusion.criterion: take a magnesium-containing medication (Mylanta, Maalox, etc.) on a regular (i.e., more than 2 days per week) basis
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: patient has no positive history of drug allergy

notes: Patient is a 34-year-old African American man with severe bone pain due to sickle cell disease. He has had multiple painful crises in the past and meets several eligibility criteria.
